title: Flag: Zimbabwe

adjectives: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).
nouns: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
Piece of cloth.
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design
The national flag of Zimbabwe consists of seven even horizontal stripes of green, gold, red and black with a white triangle containing a red 5 point star with a Zimbabwe Bird.
A country in Southern Africa. Its capital city is Harare.
The common name of the erstwhile British colony of Southern Rhodesia between the renaming of Northern Rhodesia as Zambia in 1964 and the establishment of Zimbabwe-Rhodesia in 1979.
During the Cold War
Republic of Zimbabwe.
The Colony of Southern Rhodesia was a self-governing British colony located south of the Zambezi and north of the Limpopo River in southern Africa that existed from 1923 to 1980.
Former country in Africa
Zimbabwe, officially the Republic of Zimbabwe, is a landlocked country located in southern Africa, between the Zambezi and Limpopo rivers.
Rhodesia, officially the Republic of Rhodesia from 1970 to 1979, was an unrecognised state located in southern Africa during the Cold War.

A name used to refer to the area now called Zimbabwe, officially introduced in 1901. A self-governing colony of Britain from 1923, its government began to refer to itself simply as Rhodesia in 1964, when Northern Rhodesia became Zambia. The name Zimbabwe was adopted in 1980.
A country in southern Africa.
A landlocked republic in south central Africa formerly called Rhodesia; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1980
Which later became Zimbabwe
Someone from Rhodesia
Country in Southern Africa. Official name: Republic of Zimbabwe. Formerly called Southern Rhodesia or Rhodesia.
Zimbabwe.
The opposite of secession
As its original Latin term
Government
The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
The government.
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A sovereign state.
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

description: The flag for Zimbabwe, which may show as the letters ZW on some platforms.
apple_vendor_description: The flag of Zimbabwe, as rendered on Apple devices, is a vibrant spectacle of color and detail, adhering to Apple's commitment to accurate and visually appealing representations. Its seven horizontal stripes of green, gold, red, and black are sharply defined, with the white triangle and its emblem, the Zimbabwe Bird, depicted with subtle 3D shading and realistic lighting. This flag emoji on Apple devices proudly represents the nation of Zimbabwe and its cultural heritage.
